<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/microsoft-tiktok-thrown-off-trumps-pledge-ban-app?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The TikTok Saga Continues
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok on mobile phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjk5L3Rpa3Rva19vbl9tb2JpbGVfcGhvbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, it became clear that TikTok as we know it is coming to an end in the U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said yesterday there’s a <a href="https://www.france24.com/en/20200802-tiktok-must-be-sold-or-blocked-in-us-says-mnuchin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">general consensus</a> among American leadership that “TikTok cannot stay in the current format” because of risks over Americans’ personal data. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok is owned by Chinese tech company ByteDance, which could be compelled by law to hand over user information to the Chinese government. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what happens next? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There seem to be two options: 1) ban or 2) sell to an American company. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, President Trump said he was choosing door number one—<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning Tiktok</a> from operating in the U.S. But...he didn’t, which adds further speculation to the idea that his “ban” announcement was a negotiating tactic to extract further concessions from ByteDance in the event of a sale.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what about a sale? Microsoft, which is as American as subscribing to too many newsletters, <a href="https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2020/08/02/microsoft-to-continue-discussions-on-potential-tiktok-purchase-in-the-united-states/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> last night it's been talking to ByteDance about acquiring TikTok's service in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. The company said it'll "move quickly" to reach a deal, and will finish up negotiations by Sept. 15 latest. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What an acquisition would mean for Microsoft </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s worth noting Microsoft was the only member of “Big Tech” that was absent from last week’s antitrust hearing. The company has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsofts-satya-nadella-switches-gears-in-pursuit-of-tiktok-11596250462?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">focused on business customers</a> rather than individual customers, and, with a market value of nearly $1.6 trillion, that’s been a pretty successful strategy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A TikTok acquisition would change that. </strong>Yes, Microsoft does have consumer-focused units already, most notably Xbox, which reported 65% sales growth last quarter. But its recent acquisitions—LinkedIn, GitHub, and a crowd of smaller startups to support its cloud business—were a play for the enterprise segment.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A deal for TikTok would put Microsoft in </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/31/microsoft-tiktok-deal-may-not-be-strategic-but-a-good-deal-anyway.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unfamiliar</a></span><span>—but also exciting—territory. TikTok has only just begun to monetize its exploding user base. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With several Republican senators, including China hawks, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-bytedance/republican-senators-back-plan-to-sell-tiktoks-us-operations-idUSKBN24Y0LK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">comfortable</a> with a sale to an American company, the smart money is on Microsoft pulling this one off. But the decision is President Trump's to make. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/coronavirus-updates-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The single most important factor for the health of the global economy is how well countries contain the virus. Here’s the latest…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The U.S.: </strong>not containing it well. White House coronavirus task force coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/politics/birx-coronavirus-new-phase-cnntv/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNN</a> yesterday the coronavirus is more widespread than before, impacting rural as well as urban areas.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Australia: </strong>Officials in the state of Victoria declared a “<a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/australia/victoria-coronavirus-state-of-disaster-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">state of disaster</a>” yesterday after recording record numbers of new cases over the last week. That means the city of Melbourne will be placed under a curfew from 8pm to 5am for the next six weeks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Norway: </strong>The first company to start up international cruises since they were all canceled reported 36 crew members <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/cruises/2020/08/01/hurtigruten-cruise-line-33-crew-infected-covid-19-norway/5562151002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for the coronavirus. Nearly 400 guests on two cruises have been asked to self-quarantine.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vietnam: </strong>The country will test all <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vietnam-cases/vietnams-danang-to-test-entire-population-as-outbreak-spreads-beyond-city-idUSKCN24W39A?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1.1 million residents</a> of the city of Danang after it was linked to a new outbreak. The number of coronavirus deaths in Vietnam, a country of 95 million people, remains in the single digits.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/spacex-astronauts-complete-successful-splashdown-off-west-coast-florida?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bob and Doug Yesterday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Cannonball scene from the Sandlot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=287 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/24652wmU2IQHEN3mfw/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cannonball scene from the Sandlot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/24652wmU2IQHEN3mfw/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley—the astronauts aboard SpaceX’s Dragon Endeavour capsule—executed the world’s highest cannonball yesterday. They <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/tech/nasa-spacex-crew-dragon-mission-sunday-scn/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">splashed down</a> in the Gulf of Mexico off the coast of Florida after spending the last two-ish months aboard the International Space Station.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s a big deal, </strong>because rockets, SpaceX, Elon Musk, etc. But it’s also historic: This is the first time in <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/science/nasa-astronauts-aim-for-florida-coast-to-end-spacex-flight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">45 years</a> that astronauts from any nation have returned to Earth via splashdown. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While any homecoming from space is complicated, SpaceX and NASA had to contend with the additional challenge presented by Tropical Storm Isaias, which was lashing Florida’s east coast around the same time the craft landed.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">But if there’s one good thing about Florida...</strong></span><span>it’s a peninsula, so the astronauts splashed down on the opposite coast where the weather was much calmer.   </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The astronauts’ safe return was the final step in certifying Musk’s SpaceX to begin routine, operational spaceflights to the ISS. He had this to say about it:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTYwL2Vsb25fbXVza190d2VldF9hYm91dF9zcGFjZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Elon Musk's Twitter feed</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that August is here a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/30/facebook-q2-2020-earnings-report-says-ad-boycott-will-impact-q3.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clearer picture</a> of July’s #StopHateForProfit movement, in which 1,000+ brands including Unilever, The North Face, Heineken, and Chipotle staged a public advertising boycott of Facebook, is coming into focus. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's just a flesh wound</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On its earnings call Thursday, Facebook said ad revenue <em>grew </em>10% annually in the first three weeks of July. Zuck said, “some seem to wrongly assume that our business is dependent on a few large advertisers.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Some numbers:</strong></span><span> Throughout most of July in 2019, the top 100 advertisers on FB </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/01/business/media/facebook-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent $251.4 million</a></span><span>. In 2020, that number was 12% lower, according to data from Pathmatics. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Some perspective:</strong></span><span> Facebook raked in $18.7 billion—with a “B”—in revenue in Q2. The top 100 spenders contributed 16% of those sales. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The leaders of the boycott said it <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/07/30/facebook-ad-boycott-389233?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won’t formally continue past July</a> because of the strain it puts on businesses that rely on the platform for marketing. But the movement as a whole “will get bigger and broader” until they feel Facebook takes meaningful action “to mitigate the damage it causes.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Mondays, we'll present some of the thorniest business topics of the day, give you a jumping-off point, and encourage you to debate it with friends, family, and coworkers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week’s topic: </strong>As Democrats and Republicans continue to debate a new round of COVID-19 relief, one point of contention is whether businesses should be held liable if someone contracts COVID-19 on premise. For Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, a relief bill without liability protections is a nonstarter. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What they’re both arguing (</span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/7/29/21345228/liability-shield-mitch-mcconnell-republican-safe-to-work-act-gross-negligence?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Proving a business acted negligently won’t be that easy (</span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2020/07/28/895947722/should-we-shield-businesses-from-covid-19-lawsuits?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More employers are requiring COVID-19 liability waivers anyway (</span><span><a href="https://www.rollcall.com/2020/07/29/conflicts-over-workplace-safety-mount-as-more-employers-require-covid-19-liability-waivers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Roll Call</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How effective are liability waivers? (</span><span><a href="https://www.abajournal.com/web/article/understanding-liability-waivers-in-the-age-of-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ABA Journal</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.S. Chamber of Commerce and nearly 500 business associations say COVID-19 lawsuits could deter businesses from reopening (</span><span><a href="https://www.uschamber.com/letters-congress/coalition-letter-coronavirus-liability-protections?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">U.S. Chamber</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">Audience participation alert<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">: </strong>Got a controversial business topic you want to see covered in Start Talking next week? Reply to this email with the topic and we'll select one from a reader for next Monday's edition. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CROSSWORD
</h3>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Crossword lovers, read this:</strong> We are now accepting submissions for the Brew Crossword next Monday. The details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Keep it to a 15x15 grid and email a PDF to <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="bfcbd0ddc6ffd2d0cdd1d6d1d8ddcddac891dcd0d2">[email protected]</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The NYT has some </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/14/crosswords/how-to-make-a-crossword-puzzle-the-series.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">good tips</a></span><span> on where to start. And if you want to puzzle like Toby does, </span><span><a href="http://www.keiranking.com/phil/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this is the program</a></span><span> he uses. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Submissions will be considered through Friday at noon.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now onto today's puzzle...sample clue: prickly critter (8 letters). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Play the crossword.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/microsoft-tiktok-thrown-off-trumps-pledge-ban-app?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe TikTok Saga Continues\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TikTok on mobile phone\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjk5L3Rpa3Rva19vbl9tb2JpbGVfcGhvbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis weekend, it became clear that TikTok as we know it is coming to an end in the U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said yesterday there’s a \u003ca href=\"https://www.france24.com/en/20200802-tiktok-must-be-sold-or-blocked-in-us-says-mnuchin?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egeneral consensus\u003c/a\u003e among American leadership that “TikTok cannot stay in the current format” because of risks over Americans’ personal data. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok is owned by Chinese tech company ByteDance, which could be compelled by law to hand over user information to the Chinese government. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what happens next? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere seem to be two options: 1) ban or 2) sell to an American company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis weekend, President Trump said he was choosing door number one—\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanning Tiktok\u003c/a\u003e from operating in the U.S. But...he didn’t, which adds further speculation to the idea that his “ban” announcement was a negotiating tactic to extract further concessions from ByteDance in the event of a sale.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo what about a sale? Microsoft, which is as American as subscribing to too many newsletters, \u003ca href=\"https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2020/08/02/microsoft-to-continue-discussions-on-potential-tiktok-purchase-in-the-united-states/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed\u003c/a\u003e last night it's been talking to ByteDance about acquiring TikTok's service in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. The company said it'll \"move quickly\" to reach a deal, and will finish up negotiations by Sept. 15 latest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat an acquisition would mean for Microsoft \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s worth noting Microsoft was the only member of “Big Tech” that was absent from last week’s antitrust hearing. The company has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsofts-satya-nadella-switches-gears-in-pursuit-of-tiktok-11596250462?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efocused on business customers\u003c/a\u003e rather than individual customers, and, with a market value of nearly $1.6 trillion, that’s been a pretty successful strategy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA TikTok acquisition would change that. \u003c/strong\u003eYes, Microsoft does have consumer-focused units already, most notably Xbox, which reported 65% sales growth last quarter. But its recent acquisitions—LinkedIn, GitHub, and a crowd of smaller startups to support its cloud business—were a play for the enterprise segment.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA deal for TikTok would put Microsoft in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/31/microsoft-tiktok-deal-may-not-be-strategic-but-a-good-deal-anyway.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunfamiliar\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—but also exciting—territory. TikTok has only just begun to monetize its exploding user base. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith several Republican senators, including China hawks, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-bytedance/republican-senators-back-plan-to-sell-tiktoks-us-operations-idUSKBN24Y0LK?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecomfortable\u003c/a\u003e with a sale to an American company, the smart money is on Microsoft pulling this one off. But the decision is President Trump's to make. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe single most important factor for the health of the global economy is how well countries contain the virus. Here’s the latest…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe U.S.: \u003c/strong\u003enot containing it well. White House coronavirus task force coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/politics/birx-coronavirus-new-phase-cnntv/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNN\u003c/a\u003e yesterday the coronavirus is more widespread than before, impacting rural as well as urban areas.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAustralia: \u003c/strong\u003eOfficials in the state of Victoria declared a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/02/australia/victoria-coronavirus-state-of-disaster-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estate of disaster\u003c/a\u003e” yesterday after recording record numbers of new cases over the last week. That means the city of Melbourne will be placed under a curfew from 8pm to 5am for the next six weeks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNorway: \u003c/strong\u003eThe first company to start up international cruises since they were all canceled reported 36 crew members \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/cruises/2020/08/01/hurtigruten-cruise-line-33-crew-infected-covid-19-norway/5562151002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etested positive\u003c/a\u003e for the coronavirus. Nearly 400 guests on two cruises have been asked to self-quarantine.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVietnam: \u003c/strong\u003eThe country will test all \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vietnam-cases/vietnams-danang-to-test-entire-population-as-outbreak-spreads-beyond-city-idUSKCN24W39A?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1.1 million residents\u003c/a\u003e of the city of Danang after it was linked to a new outbreak. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile any homecoming from space is complicated, SpaceX and NASA had to contend with the additional challenge presented by Tropical Storm Zuck said, “some seem to wrongly assume that our business is dependent on a few large advertisers.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome numbers:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Throughout most of July in 2019, the top 100 advertisers on FB \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/01/business/media/facebook-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent $251.4 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. In 2020, that number was 12% lower, according to data from Pathmatics. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome perspective:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Facebook raked in $18.7 billion—with a “B”—in revenue in Q2. The top 100 spenders contributed 16% of those sales. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe leaders of the boycott said it \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/07/30/facebook-ad-boycott-389233?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon’t formally continue past July\u003c/a\u003e because of the strain it puts on businesses that rely on the platform for marketing. But the movement as a whole “will get bigger and broader” until they feel Facebook takes meaningful action “to mitigate the damage it causes.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS \u003c/strong\u003eAs Democrats and Republicans continue to debate a new round of COVID-19 relief, one point of contention is whether businesses should be held liable if someone contracts COVID-19 on premise. For Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, a relief bill without liability protections is a nonstarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat they’re both arguing (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/7/29/21345228/liability-shield-mitch-mcconnell-republican-safe-to-work-act-gross-negligence?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVox\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eProving a business acted negligently won’t be that easy (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2020/07/28/895947722/should-we-shield-businesses-from-covid-19-lawsuits?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNPR\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore employers are requiring COVID-19 liability waivers anyway (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.rollcall.com/2020/07/29/conflicts-over-workplace-safety-mount-as-more-employers-require-covid-19-liability-waivers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRoll Call\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHow effective are liability waivers? (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.abajournal.com/web/article/understanding-liability-waivers-in-the-age-of-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eABA Journal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. Chamber of Commerce and nearly 500 business associations say COVID-19 lawsuits could deter businesses from reopening (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.uschamber.com/letters-congress/coalition-letter-coronavirus-liability-protections?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eU.S. Chamber\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003eAudience participation alert\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/police-cars-revolving-light_1f6a8.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e: \u003c/strong\u003eGot a controversial business topic you want to see covered in Start Talking next week?
